lines.text: No one should be buried without something to keep them warm. Mona and Mr. Mole won't do it, so I will!

[Three ferocious wolves have ran away frightened]
Are you all right, Big Bear?
I am now.
Those wolves sure turned tail and ran, didn't they? Maybe I'm stronger than I think.
I don't know about being strong, but you sure are brave.

[Two bears appear]
I'll say she is. I wouldn't've been brave enough to stand up to three wolves with just a twig.
Thumbelina, meet my brothers. Billy Bear and Bertin Bear.

[Disappointed]
The wolves were running from them?
So what? What you did took courage. No one could have a better friend than you.
You really think so?
Strange. Every time I fall asleep, I wake up in a different place.
Hello Mona, Thumbelina. Humph! I've been visiting so often I thought It would be easier just to dig a tunnel between my house and yours.

[to Thumbelina]
See? I told you he's crazy about you.

[Thumbelina is helped onto her feet by a fox]
Well, look'a what we got here. You must be the farmer's wife.
Thanks for helping me up, but why on earth would you think I'm the farmer's wife?
Because the farmer who owns this here farm had such a small harvest, I figured you went and shrunk up from lack of food.
[laughs hysterically]
Well I'm not the farmer's wife. And I don't think that's a very funny joke.
Hey, what do you want, kid, I'm out here starving.
You're not going to eat me for dinner, are you?
Well, I wouldn't exactly call you a dinner. I'd call a chicken a dinner. I'd call a rabbit a dinner, but you barely qualify for the morsel category, so I wouldn't worry too much.
Well... Look who's awake.
Oh, don't hurt me. I'm a very small girl.
Every mother wants to find the perfect girl for her son to marry. Hahaha, lucky me, I found you, ribbet.
[to her son]
Hush up.
Look, I'm sure you're nice and, I'm sure your son's nice. For a frog. But there's a whole kingdom of Little People depending on me, so, if you'll just help me be on my way...
Start thinking wedding bells, honey. You're going to be walking down the aisle.
[the frog and her son swim away]

[to herself]
Oh, this is terrible. How will I ever get to the meadow?
Oh, you saved me! How can I ever thank you?
You don't happen to have any worms, do ya?
No, but...
Are you sure she's not a bug?
Nah, let's bail!
Mm! I just love the smell of dirt in the morning.
It's so dark in here I can barely see.
Ooh, you'll get used to it, my dear. You'll come to love the dark as I do. You find all sorts of interesting things in the ground, for instance, look at this.

[there's a swallow lying dead on the ground; Thumbelina gasps]
Oh!
Now how- however did a bird get down here?
Birds are not the smartest of creatures, you know.

[runs to the swallow's side]
Oh, poor thing. He looks like the swallow who sang to me once long ago.
You can bet he won't be singing anymore!
[both Mr. Mole and Mona laugh]
Please don't make fun of him. This could be the bird who sang to me. He was a sweet bird...
Augh, don't be a silly girl. All swallows look alike, you can't tell one from the other.
Unlike moles, which are quite distinctive.
Mm-hmm, especially one so noble looking as yourself. We have to get back home.

[a child-less woman opens her front door and sees a witch standing there]
Well, are you gonna invite me in or stare at me all night?
Ah. Oh, yes! Eh, please, come in!
That's better. Now, let's get down to business. Time is money you know, and speaking of money...
The money? Ah, of course, I- I have it right here. I believe the price was twenty pieces of gold.
[the witch reaches over for the money]
But, where is the child you promised to find me?

[pulls out a red tulip]
Here we are.
That's no child, that's a tulip.
Yes, but it's no ordinary tulip. Plant it in a flower pot and you shall soon have your child.
If this doesn't bring me a child, I'll- I'm gonna find you and get my money back!
Fine, I never had to give a refund yet.
You made it! But how on earth?
With some help from my friend!
[Thumbelina turns to the swallow, who winks at her]
What can be taking that old crook so long? If he dares to try backing out of our deal I'll...
Hello, Mona. Beautiful day for a wedding, isn't it?
And even a more beautiful day to pay the one who introduced you to your blushing bride.
